page.title: 06Manufacturing in F.O.Green
page.content: There are several small industrial businesses in the village,employing some local labour. Elliss',once one of the many blacksmiths in the area ,now builds bodies for vans and lorries.Two of the grandsons still make gun carriage wheels for which their grandfather, Isaac Elliss,was famous. He made Capel School maypole 30 years ago. Another old established business is the Summers Fencing firm.This has prospered with motorway construction and subsequent fencing off of adjacent land.Raw materials are supplied by local coppicing of chestnut. A thriving business,Capel Canoes, occupies the building which was once the local bakery and manufactures 500 fibre glass canoes a year. Other firms include P.G. Transport and Caroline's Home.
